English.alert.clipboard: The Current Number and Current Text have been copied to the clipboard.
English.alert.clipboard.local: The Current Number and Current Text have been copied to the local clipboard.
English.alert.firstRun:
App Framework is a starting point for shortcut developers to create applications in Shortcuts. It features:

• Preferences
• Localization
• Application Loop
• vCard Menus
• Pseudo-Global Variables
• Pseudo-Local Variables
• Pseudo-Classes
• Pseudo-Functions

App Framework has plenty of comments to help you understand how the framework operates. You’ll be up and running writing your own shortcut applications in no time!
English.alert.firstRun2: Turn on Show Debugging Information in Settings to display alerts during program execution, in and out of the main application loop.
English.alert.update: This shortcut will now close and open Safari to the shortcut's page on RoutineHub.co. Compare the version number below with that on RoutineHub and update if necessary.
English.alert.update.title: Check for App Framework Updates
English.alert.welcome:
App Framework is a starting point for creating shortcut applications with:

Preferences, localization, application loop, vCard menus, global variables, local variables, classes, functions, and more

https://tow.com/shortcuts/framework/

By Adam Tow • tow.com • @atow
English.debug.input.empty:
Shortcut Input EMPTY

App Loop -> Application.menus -> Application.welcome
English.debug.input.notEmpty:
Shortcut Input NOT EMPTY:

App Loop -> Application.menus -> Program.start
English.debug.menu.name: Menu Name:
